case.sLatestTextSummary: Email reference: From: Guevara, Luis Sent: Tuesday, November 13, 2012 8:35 PM To: Rajendran, Pandiarajan; Egan, Jay; BavaRaju, Krishna Kishore; Khalid, Mohamed; Taylor, Lyndsey; Thomas, Frank Cc: Prasad, Guru; Chockalingam, Balakumar; Sharma, ...
case.sTitle: HCA Farwest Issue:

event.s:
Email reference:
From: Guevara, Luis Sent: Tuesday, November 13, 2012 8:35 PM To: Rajendran, Pandiarajan; Egan, Jay; BavaRaju, Krishna Kishore; Khalid, Mohamed; Taylor, Lyndsey; Thomas, Frank Cc: Prasad, Guru; Chockalingam, Balakumar; Sharma, Prashant; Vempati, Karthik; Iyengar, Kavitha; Jagadeesan, Rajesh; Shanmugasundaram, Arun; Binswanger, Kevin; Kostic, Melissa; Khan, Rizwan Subject: RE: HCA Far West Issue
I’m adding Rizwan (CCC Dev DBA) to the discussion. Can you send the query and we’ll run a test? If it’s something as simple as Select * from dbo.PDFRequestQueue, this is comign back in less than a second from the prod DB server.
####################################################################
Teams saw slow performance and they recommended server hardware upgrade, so Luis involved me. On other side we found Jay Egan has removed lots of records from measure mapping for Far West, and we immediately saw performance gain, but Sai suggested performance is still slow enough for us to keep on investigating any optimization opportunities. I am working with Kevin Baswinger to identify SQL queries that may cause problems, yesterday we profiled SQL on dev and for 30+ minute of entire process, we found SQL was only 176 seconds. Found out, that somehow if profiler is running those queries might not end up in ring buffer for EE, also found out some dynamic SQL calls were not captured by EE if you scope your collection by database, will work on these two issues to perfect EE collection so it can be used with other debugging situation as well
event.sHtml:
Email reference:

From: Guevara, Luis
Sent: Tuesday, November 13, 2012 8:35 PM
To: Rajendran, Pandiarajan; Egan, Jay; BavaRaju, Krishna Kishore; Khalid, Mohamed; Taylor, Lyndsey; Thomas, Frank
Cc: Prasad, Guru; Chockalingam, Balakumar; Sharma, Prashant; Vempati, Karthik; Iyengar, Kavitha; Jagadeesan, Rajesh; Shanmugasundaram, Arun; Binswanger, Kevin; Kostic, Melissa; Khan, Rizwan
Subject: RE: HCA Far West Issue
 
I’m adding Rizwan (CCC Dev DBA) to the discussion.  Can you send the query and we’ll run a test?  If it’s something as simple as Select * from dbo.PDFRequestQueue, this is comign back in less than a second from the prod DB server.
 
 
####################################################################

Teams saw slow performance and they recommended server hardware upgrade, so Luis involved me.
On other side we found Jay Egan has removed lots of records from measure mapping for Far West, and we immediately saw performance gain, but Sai suggested performance is still slow enough for us to keep on investigating any optimization opportunities.
I am working with Kevin Baswinger to identify SQL queries that may cause problems, yesterday we profiled SQL on dev and for 30+ minute of entire process, we found SQL was only 176 seconds.
Found out, that somehow if profiler is running those queries might not end up in ring buffer for EE, also found out some dynamic SQL calls were not captured by EE if you scope your collection by database, will work on these two issues to perfect EE collection so it can be used with other debugging situation as well

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Rizwan Khan by Rizwan Khan

case.sLatestTextSummary: 2+ hours meeting with Dale, this meeting was in person, had a 1+ hour goto meeting with them last week, this time I went through all configuration aspects of SQL server and provided them with supporting scripts & links
case.sTitle: Work with Mark Holt/Tim Farmer for SQL server tuning

event.s: Go to meeting with Tim Farmer, found out memory is the immediate issue on this machine, with low PLE (120) and absolutely nothing in plan cache there was not a whole I could do to identify query bottlenecks, submitted IT ticket to raise memory from 16GB to 48GB
event.sHtml: Go to meeting with Tim Farmer, found out memory is the immediate issue on this machine, with low PLE (120) and absolutely nothing in plan cache there was not a whole I could do to identify query bottlenecks, submitted IT ticket to raise memory from 16GB to 48GB

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Rizwan Khan by Rizwan Khan

event.s: Chase added 8GB more to this server, now waiting for my access to this server to verify if we have any performance improvement or better PLE on machine
event.sHtml: Chase added 8GB more to this server, now waiting for my access to this server to verify if we have any performance improvement or better PLE on machine

event.s: Chase apparently added 8GB to wrong server, but Tim changed power setting on this server, our PLE went from 120 seconds to 158 hours, I am still trying to correlate if change in power setting is directly related to this performance boost. Also on 10/24/2012, Gary invited me for a meeting with Ann Arbor team, where they had issues with ETL process, they were complaining about deadlocks I investigated default trace and found 92 deadlocks, I sent Tim XML graphs for those deadlocks. They changed few time off settings on their end to resolve this issue for meanwhile.
event.sHtml:
Chase apparently added 8GB to wrong server,
but Tim changed power setting on this server, our PLE went from 120 seconds to 158 hours, I am still trying to correlate if change in power setting is directly related to this performance boost.
Also on 10/24/2012, Gary invited me for a meeting with Ann Arbor team, where they had issues with ETL process, they were complaining about deadlocks I investigated default trace and found 92 deadlocks, I sent Tim XML graphs for those deadlocks. They changed few time off settings on their end to resolve this issue for meanwhile.

case.sLatestTextSummary: Created following script for Eric, maybe will have to make this a stored proc, or a SQL job?, will figure out details after further discussion
case.sTitle: temp_raw_% tables

event.s:
From: Vaughan, Eric Sent: Tuesday, October 16, 2012 11:14 AM To: Rizwan, Khan Cc: Guevara, Luis; Hoffman, Chase; Thomas, Frank; McJilton, Josh; Crimson Clinical Advantage BAs; Crimson Accountable Care BAs; Crimson CCC DataAnalyst Leads; Crimson CCI DataAnalysts Subject: Truncating temp_raw_% tables for non-CCI members on the production DBs
Hi Rizwan,
After much discussion with our BAs, DAs, and Luis, we would like to run a script to truncate all temp_raw_% tables on non-CCI production DBs. The pros outweighed the cons in our evaluation and this is something that we would like to do. We cannot remove the temp_raw_ data from CI members as some of these tables contain report information that may be in use by various users.
Below is a script that will generate the appropriate truncate table statements for all non-CI production DBs:
select distinct 'truncate table '+Table_name from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS where table_name like 'temp_raw_%' and db_name() not like 'CCI_%'
Once you have the script written to truncate these tables, please let me know so I can review it before you run it against the .17.169 DB server.
BAs and DAs - Although this is an ad hoc activity, I will be discussing with the CCC dev team to see if this kind of logic can be applied to the data migration process in a future release.
Thank you,
Eric Vaughan
event.sHtml:
From: Vaughan, Eric
Sent: Tuesday, October 16, 2012 11:14 AM
To: Rizwan, Khan
Cc: Guevara, Luis; Hoffman, Chase; Thomas, Frank; McJilton, Josh; Crimson Clinical Advantage BAs; Crimson Accountable Care BAs; Crimson CCC DataAnalyst Leads; Crimson CCI DataAnalysts
Subject: Truncating temp_raw_% tables for non-CCI members on the production DBs

Hi Rizwan,

After much discussion with our BAs, DAs, and Luis, we would like to run a script to truncate all temp_raw_% tables on non-CCI production DBs.  The pros outweighed the cons in our evaluation and this is something that we would like to do. We cannot remove the temp_raw_ data from CI members as some of these tables contain report information that may be in use by various users. 

Below is a script that will generate the appropriate truncate table statements for all non-CI production DBs:

select distinct 'truncate table '+Table_name from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS where table_name like 'temp_raw_%' and db_name() not like 'CCI_%'

Once you have the script written to truncate these tables, please let me know so I can review it before you run it against the .17.169 DB server.


BAs and DAs - Although this is an ad hoc activity, I will be discussing with the CCC dev team to see if this kind of logic can be applied to the data migration process in a future release.


Thank you,

Eric Vaughan

case.sTitle: SiteManager + sp_databases + getting rid of testdev

event.s:
Hi All,
In our development environment (.16 subnet), SiteManager currently connects to each SQL Server to execute the “sp_databases” stored procedure. It does so using the testdev/testdev password.
To get away from using testdev/testdev for this, and to deploy my new Yggdrasil application, I need DEVID\Yggdrasil to be a SQL Server login on each of the SQL Servers in our dev environment, and this user needs permission to execute the stored procedure “sp_databases”.
If possible, this request is fairly urgent. I am trying to get Yggdrasil deployed in our development environment ASAP and this is a blocking point.
Below is the list of SQL Server machines that need this change (note that some of these servers may no longer exist or have SQL installed on them):
192.168.16.112 192.168.16.114 192.168.16.115 192.168.16.141 192.168.16.142 192.168.16.144 192.168.16.186 192.168.16.189 192.168.16.191 192.168.16.195 192.168.16.200 192.168.16.42 192.168.16.80 192.168.16.82 192.168.16.84 192.168.16.86
Please let me know you have any questions or there is anything I can do to help.
Thanks! Brock
event.sHtml:
Hi All,
 
In our development environment (.16 subnet), SiteManager currently connects to each SQL Server to execute the “sp_databases” stored procedure.  It does so using the testdev/testdev password.
 
To get away from using testdev/testdev for this, and to deploy my new Yggdrasil application, I need DEVID\Yggdrasil to be a SQL Server login on each of the SQL Servers in our dev environment, and this user needs permission to execute the stored procedure “sp_databases”.
 
If possible, this request is fairly urgent.  I am trying to get Yggdrasil deployed in our development environment ASAP and this is a blocking point.
 
Below is the list of SQL Server machines that need this change (note that some of these servers may no longer exist or have SQL installed on them):
 
192.168.16.112
192.168.16.114
192.168.16.115
192.168.16.141
192.168.16.142
192.168.16.144
192.168.16.186
192.168.16.189
192.168.16.191
192.168.16.195
192.168.16.200
192.168.16.42
192.168.16.80
192.168.16.82
192.168.16.84
192.168.16.86
 
Please let me know you have any questions or there is anything I can do to help.
 
Thanks!
Brock

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Keith Chirco (PA) by Ammad Admin (PA)
Assigned to Rizwan Khan by Ammad Admin (PA)

event.s:
Out of these, 192.168.16.112 and 192.168.16.141 dont have SQL installed and I dont have any sort of access on 192.168.16.82 Besides these user is created on all SQL servers, and user has access to sp_databases
Rizwan
event.evtDescription: Resolved (Needs Review) and assigned to Brock Bouchard by Rizwan Khan
event.sHtml:
Out of these,
192.168.16.112 and 192.168.16.141 dont have SQL installed and I dont have any sort of access on 192.168.16.82

event.s:
Hi Rizwan,
For .16.195, sp_databases seems to be successfully executing, but returns no databases. There are indeed databases on that machine, and other accounts seem to return the list.
To rule out issues with my code, I verified this behavior by executing SSMS as the DEVID\Yggdrasil user:
runas /user:DEVID\Yggdrasil "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SQL Server\100\Tools\Binn\VSShell\Common7\IDE\Ssms.exe"
This is blocking the CCC QA team from deploying, and is thus pretty urgent.
Thanks,
Brock
event.evtDescription: Reactivated (assigned to Rizwan Khan) by Brock Bouchard
event.sHtml:
Hi Rizwan,

For .16.195, sp_databases seems to be successfully executing, but returns no databases.  There are indeed databases on that machine, and other accounts seem to return the list.

To rule out issues with my code, I verified this behavior by executing SSMS as the DEVID\Yggdrasil user:

runas /user:DEVID\Yggdrasil "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SQL Server\100\Tools\Binn\VSShell\Common7\IDE\Ssms.exe"

This is blocking the CCC QA team from deploying, and is thus pretty urgent.

Thanks,

Brock

event.s:
Hey Brock its fixed for now, I dont understand how it can skip that server it was one powershell script to touch all servers, anyway till I find that script I wont be able to confirm why it didnt work. sorry for causing this, hopefully this works now
Rizwan
event.evtDescription: Resolved (Needs Review) and assigned to Brock Bouchard by Rizwan Khan

event.s: Pulled this ticket under "Crimson-DBA" project Brock and I talked about this usage and decided to deprecate sp_databases usage and instead go "select name from sys.database" approach, cause this way we only need to create one login in master database and give read-only access to only sys.database DMV
event.sChanges: Project changed from 'DevOps' to 'Crimson-DBA'. Area changed from 'Server Software' to 'Database Engineering'. Added tag '53172'.
event.sHtml:
Pulled this ticket under "Crimson-DBA" project
Brock and I talked about this usage and decided to deprecate sp_databases usage and instead go "select name from sys.database" approach, cause this way we only need to create one login in master database and give read-only access to only sys.database DMV

event.s: Per our discussion, we wont use this approach anymore, we created this user only in master database and now we are querying sys.databases DMV to get desired result. Already used this approach in dev environment and gave Brock a powershell script for producttion. Please close this ticket
event.evtDescription: Resolved (Won't Implement) and assigned to Ammad Admin (PA) by Rizwan Khan
event.sHtml:
Per our discussion, we wont use this approach anymore, we created this user only in master database and now we are querying sys.databases DMV to get desired result. Already used this approach in dev environment and gave Brock a powershell script for producttion.
Please close this ticket

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Rizwan Khan by Rizwan Khan

event.s:
I got an error suggesting a cab file is corrupted
Initially this error can be because either there is an actual corruption or we were on VM, But when both are not true it can be root certificate related problem
Here is a possible solution but I need Window SDK to go around it http://blogs.msdn.com/b/heaths/archive/2008/12/11/another-possible-workaround-for-error-1330.aspx
or this one which talks about how to update root certificate https://support.quest.com/SolutionDetail.aspx?id=SOL88083
event.sHtml:
I got an error suggesting a cab file is corrupted

Initially this error can be because either there is an actual corruption or we were on VM,
But when both are not true it can be root certificate related problem

Here is a possible solution but I need Window SDK to go around it
http://blogs.msdn.com/b/heaths/archive/2008/12/11/another-possible-workaround-for-error-1330.aspx

or this one which talks about how to update root certificate
https://support.quest.com/SolutionDetail.aspx?id=SOL88083

case.sLatestTextSummary: I couldnt get access to 17.22, so I wrote a generic powershell script for Brock, he can just plugin servers as comma separated list in this PS script and just run it across all servers from just one machine
case.sTitle: Script for CRIMSONAD\Yggdrasil user + Master Database

event.s:
Email from Brock 10/21/2012 @ 5:34pm
Hi Rizwan,
Just as we needed to make the DEVID\Yggdrasil user a login with access to master on all development database servers, we need to do the same for production. I was wondering if you had some scripts that could easily be changed for production, or could make the change on Monday or Tuesday. Chase and I will be doing an upgrade at 5 PM on Tuesday that requires this change to be made.
You can a get a list of all the database servers in production by running the following query on the production SiteManager database (which I think is on .17.22… Chase please confirm):
select [Address] from [Servers] where ServerType = 0
Thanks,
Brock
event.sHtml:
Email from Brock 10/21/2012 @ 5:34pm

Hi Rizwan,

Just as we needed to make the DEVID\Yggdrasil user a login with access to master on all development database servers, we need to do the same for production.  I was wondering if you had some scripts that could easily be changed for production, or could make the change on Monday or Tuesday.  Chase and I will be doing an upgrade at 5 PM on Tuesday that requires this change to be made.

You can a get a list of all the database servers in production by running the following query on the production SiteManager database (which I think is on .17.22… Chase please confirm):

select [Address]
from [Servers]
where ServerType = 0

Thanks,

Brock

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Rizwan Khan by Rizwan Khan

case.sTitle: Master Database Usage: Write Protocols

event.s: Master database is heavily used in all production servers, write a protocol to limit Master DB usage, investigate why teams need this access and provide better alternatives, also ways to audit any DDL changes in Master database

case.sLatestTextSummary: changes were deployed on live, tempDB usage now show correct file growth and predicts better workload handliing
case.sTitle: Balance TempDB files on cccprddbcls01

event.s: TempDB files were out of balance on this server, with total 8 files for 40 available cores (20 Hyperthreaded), some files were growing in % others in in fixed size, and files had wrong initial start size. Changed TempDB files, now we have 20 files, each starting at 100MB initial size with 10MB growth at a time
event.sHtml:
TempDB files were out of balance on this server, with total 8 files for 40 available cores (20 Hyperthreaded), some files were growing in % others in in fixed size, and files had wrong initial start size.
Changed TempDB files, now we have 20 files, each starting at 100MB initial size with 10MB growth at a time

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Rizwan Khan by Rizwan Khan

event.s: changes were deployed on live, tempDB usage now show correct file growth and predicts better workload handliing
event.evtDescription: Resolved (Needs Review) and assigned to Rizwan Khan by Rizwan Khan
event.sHtml: changes were deployed on live, tempDB usage now show correct file growth and predicts better workload handliing

case.sLatestTextSummary: Maintenance jobs on our production databases are taking longer cause of database count/size on each server, my plan is to write a dynamic job that creates multiple maintenance jobs dynamically and runs between certain time on selected day of the ...
case.sTitle: Write Dynamic Index/Stats maintenance job

event.s: Maintenance jobs on our production databases are taking longer cause of database count/size on each server, my plan is to write a dynamic job that creates multiple maintenance jobs dynamically and runs between certain time on selected day of the week, this job should also keep log entry of which indices/stats were updated/not updated so DBA team can go back and debug underlying issues
event.sHtml: Maintenance jobs on our production databases are taking longer cause of database count/size on each server, my plan is to write a dynamic job that creates multiple maintenance jobs dynamically and runs between certain time on selected day of the week, this job should also keep log entry of which indices/stats were updated/not updated so DBA team can go back and debug underlying issues

event.evtDescription: Assigned to Rizwan Khan by Rizwan Khan
